results.title: The Basic elements of production
results.brief_description: Compares the simple production of hand-made pottery with modern mass production methods, showing the basic similarities in the two processes. Emphasizes the interdependence of natural resources, labour, capital, and management in both processes. Explains the role of the consumer in the production of goods and services and in regulating their supply. No credits available.

results.title: The Bargain
results.creator_credit: W.M. Larkins Studio, Film Producers Guild and Beryl Stevens
results.brief_description: An animated film on how to buy a steam roller without enough ready money. The intending purchaser is shown the advantages of everyday banking and the services offered by the modern bank to its customer. Designed to convince the ordinary wage earner that it is sensible for several reasons to have a current account with a bank.

results.title: The Barber of Seville by Rossini
results.brief_description: Rossini’s comic opera, sung in Italian. One of a series of “opera-films”, which feature the chorus and orchestra and some of the principals of the Rome Opera House, La Scala, Milan, and other famous Italian opera companies; each film combines scenes from a performance of the opera with an english-language commentary which explains the plot and telescopes the action. Features Tito Gobbi as Figaro.

results.title: The Bank holiday crisis of 1933
results.creator_credit: James Fonda, Young America Films and William Russell
results.brief_description: In March, 1933, President Roosevelt declared a bank holiday to help the American nation recover from the panic of financial collapse. The situation is shown in scenes in a bank, in soup kitchens and milk lines and in a Salvation Army home in New York. Narrated by Walter Cronkite.

results.title: The Band concert
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney and Walt Disney Productions
results.brief_description: Despite interference from a bee, a noisy Donald Duck playing “Turkey in the Straw”, and a full scale whirlwind, Mickey’s band doggedly performs the “William Tell Overture”. This was the first Mickey Mouse cartoon to use technicolor and is considered to be one of the Disney studios best.

results.title: The Bamboo Curtain Falls
results.brief_description: This is the second part of a two part documentary that looks at the mysterious story of Tibet. It is the story about a country unseen by Europeans until early this century, of its destruction by invading Chinese in 1950, and the flight into India of the Dalai Lama with 100,000 Tibetans.

results.title: The Baltimore plan
results.brief_description: Explains how a young social worker aroused the interest of citizens, government officials, and a local newspaper in the housing conditions in Baltimore’s slums. Describes the “Baltimore Plan” which made minimum housing standards a legal requirement and which created a Housing Court to enforce the laws. Shows how officials and citizens in Baltimore attacked the problem in selected areas. No other credits available.

results.title: The Baltic story
results.creator_credit: Gordon Bradley Ltd and Gordon Bradley
results.brief_description: Produced for the Baltimore Mercantile and Shipping Exchange, this film describes the world-wide activities of the Baltic Exchange. This is the international centre for the chartering of ships and aircraft - a vast clearing house where carriers are found for cargo and cargo for carriers - to and from any port in the world. The Baltic has the distinction of being the world’s only shipping exchange. Narrated by John Le Mesurier the film features the work of a broker, John Hall, during a day at the exchange.

results.title: The Bakhtiari migration
results.creator_credit: Films Incorporated, Anthony-David Productions, Anthony Howarth and David Koff
results.brief_description: An excellent record of one of the most hazardous feats of human endurance still undertaken. Shows the way in which half a million people together with millions of valuable sheep, goats, mules and dogs, struggle for five weeks to make the two hundred mile crossing of the Zagros mountains, South Iran.

results.title: The Badminton Horse Trials
results.creator_credit: Town and Country Productions and Bill Latto
results.brief_description: A record of the three-day event at the 1962 Badminton Horse Trials, showing famous riders and their mounts in training and the preparations made for transport and stabling. Events include dressage, cross country steeple chasing and show jumping. the Queen attends and presents prizes.
